analysis: The documents primarily concern adjustments to the salaries and pay scales for various branches of the United States government, including the General Schedule, Foreign Service, Veterans Health Administration, Senior Executive Service, Executive Schedule, Congress, Justices and Judges, Uniformed Services, and Administrative Law Judges. They also cover locality-based comparability payments and within-grade salary advancements. The documents span several decades and reflect changes in pay rates and regulations over time.
title: Federal Government Pay Adjustments
